intro: Phormium hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker’s flaxflower, is a striking evergreen plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asphodelaceae family and is characterized by its broad, sword-shaped leaves that are often colored in shades of blue-green. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences bearing clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers in yellow or orange. It is well adapted to coastal environments and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Phormium hookeri is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in garden settings.
